result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JAMES W UNSER

defendant.name: UNSER, JAMES W
defendant.address: 131 E MAIN ST # 1, NEW AUBURN, WI 54757

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant JAMES W UNSER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for JAMES W UNSER.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Defendant does not wish to proceed until he speaks with Attorney. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(Jail/5053)
PFAC packet placed in CHSO Jail interoffice mail for defendant.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Defendant shall not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
Defendant shall not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license. 
Daily PBTs at CHSO.
Defendant JAMES W UNSER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for JAMES W UNSER.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.
